intro: Stylidium burbidgeanum, commonly known as the burbidge's triggerplant, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its unique trigger mechanism that aids in pollination. The plant produces striking red or orange flowers that are often adorned with dark veins. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is typically found in open habitats. Stylidium burbidgeanum is a perennial herb that is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
